newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid air cargo up 1.3pc in March, up 8.1 pc in Q.
newsitem.headline: Madrid air cargo up 1.3pc in March, up 8.1 pc in Q.

text.p: Cargo traffic at Madrid's Barajas airport rose 1.3 percent in March to 22,961 tonnes, compared with the same month last year, taking the total for the first quarter of this year to 65,269 tonnes, 8.1 percent more than 1996, the airport authority said.
The volume of mail passing through the airport fell 16.2 percent in the month to 1,848 tonnes, putting the accumulated total at 5,780 tonnes, 8.5 percent less than the same period last year.

Passenger numbers rose 11.6 percent in March to 1.99 million, or 5.33 million in the quarter, an increase of 12.0 percent. The number of air transport movements increased 12.4 percent to 21,989, taking the quarterly total to 63,015, 11.6 percent more than in 1996. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+5017
